name: Canal House
calculationsAnalysis: The Canal House represents specialized waterfront residential property with direct transportation access. The construction cost of 2,000,000 ducats reflects the premium waterfront location and specialized water-level construction, while the income of 35,000 ducats (1.75% return) represents the premium rent such properties commanded. The maintenance cost of 11,000 ducats (31% of income) shows an increased maintenance ratio, reflecting the challenges of maintaining structures in direct contact with water. The residentsCapacity of 8 represents a prosperous family with servants. The construction time of 5 days (432000000ms) reflects the specialized waterfront construction requirements. This building creates a strategic residential option with transportation advantages, reflecting Venice's unique water-based urban structure.
shortDescription: Multi-story residence with direct canal access for convenient transportation.
fullDescription: A practical yet prestigious home with a private water entrance (porta d'acqua) directly on a canal. These versatile buildings allow residents to receive goods and visitors directly by boat. The water-level entrance typically includes a small private dock and storage area, with living quarters above.
flavorText: In Venice, a door to the water is worth more than a door to the streetâ€”for water is the true street of the Serenissima.

soundDesign.ambientSound: Water lapping against foundation, boat traffic
soundDesign.activitySounds: Boat docking, goods being unloaded, water gate opening

seasonalEffects.winter: Fog rising from canal, ice protection at waterline
seasonalEffects.acqua alta: Water barriers at doorways, elevated walkways visible
seasonalEffects.carnival: Colorful lanterns hanging over water entrance, decorated gondola
